definition: more critical with every passing day
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
to hasten/to hurry/to walk fast/to approach/to tend towards/to converge

sentences.english: L/C Payment problem is becoming serious to each bank.
sentences.chinese: 信用证垫款问题是各银行面对的日趋严重的一个问题。

sentences.english: Occurring and harming of the wheat aphids have not decreased, and there is a more serious trend instead.
sentences.chinese: 麦蚜的发生危害没有减轻，反而有日趋严重的趋势。
实际上郊区贫困化问题正在日趋严重。

sentences.english: China has sought to calm the growing controversy.
sentences.chinese: 中国已在试图平息这一日趋严重的争议。

sentences.english: In recent years, it has been more serious of marriage crisis in migrant family.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，农民工家庭发生婚变的问题日趋严重。

sentences.english: Today, as coaches are becoming increasingly homogenized , competition within this industry is heating up.
sentences.chinese: 在客车同置化日趋严重的今天，行业竞争也日益激烈。

sentences.english: Cybercrimes have become increasingly serious with the development of information technology.
sentences.chinese: 随着信息技术的不断发展，计算机犯罪日趋严重。

sentences.english: In recent years, the gender disproportion problem of newly-born population is growing more and more serious.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，我国出生人口性别比失衡现象日趋严重。

sentences.english: Recently job-related corruption in accounting by means of fabrication is getting more serious.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，会计腐败现象日趋严重，假账之风愈演愈烈。

definition: (increasing) day by day/(more critical) with every passing day/gradually
day by day/more and more/increasingly/more and more with each passing day
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
year after year/with each passing year/over the years
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
to progress (or increase, change etc) day by day/more (or better etc) with each passing day
